Class Project

java.lang.Object
Project
public class Project extends Object
This is the class which keeps project information such name, deadline, total fee etc. using variables (Notably this includes project address information). This class also contains methods which interact with the database when relating to updating project information.
Version:
1.00 09 July 2024
Author:
Connor Wallace

    • assignProjectValues

      public Project assignProjectValues(Project project, Scanner sc, String userInput)
      Method which assigns values to a project object. Specifically for building type, total fee, amount paid, and deadline.
      Parameters:
      project - project object
      sc - object to get user inputs
      userInput - user's input
      Returns:
      updated project object

      statement - the object used to query the database

      public String getProjectId(String userInput, Scanner scObj, ResultSet results, Statement statement) throws SQLException

      userInput - the user's input

      results - results of query statements
      statement - statement used to execute queries
      Returns:

      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • getProjectName

      public String getProjectName(String userInput, Scanner scObj, String customerLastName, String projectBuildingType)
      Method to get the name a project from the user. If no name is entered, the name will be made from the project's customer's last name and the project's building type. Returns the project name.
      Parameters:
      userInput - the user's input
      scObj - scanner object to get user inputs
      customerLastName - the last name of the customer associated with the project being named
      projectBuildingType - the building type of the project
      Returns:
      the name of a project

    • getFinalisationStatus

      public boolean getFinalisationStatus(String userInput, Scanner scObj)
      Method which prompts the user to set the finalisation status of a project and returns a boolean based on whether the project is finalised or not.
      Parameters:
      userInput - the user's input
      scObj - scanner object used to get the user's input
      Returns:
      boolean value representing finalisation status

    • getFinalisationStatusFromDataBase

      public boolean getFinalisationStatusFromDataBase(ResultSet results, Statement statement, String projectId) throws SQLException
      Method which gets the finalisation status of a project in the database and returns a boolean valuer representing the status.
      Parameters:
      results - object which stores the results of a query statement
      statement - object used to query the database
      projectId - ID/project number of the project being queried
      Returns:
      boolean value for finalisation status
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • insertProject

      public void insertProject(Statement statement, String projectName, String projectBuildingType, String projectFee, String amountPaid, String projectDeadline, String projectAddressId, String architectId, String contractorId, String customerId) throws SQLException
      Method to enter a new project into the database
      Parameters:
      statement - object which inserts the data to the database
      projectName - name of the project
      projectBuildingType - building type of the project
      projectFee - total fee of the project
      amountPaid - money paid for the project
      projectDeadline - deadline for the project
      projectAddressId - the id of the project's address
      architectId - id of architect associated with the project
      contractorId - id of the contractor associated with the project
      customerId - id of the customer associated with the project
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • displayProjects

      public boolean displayProjects(ResultSet results, Statement statement) throws SQLException
      Method to display the project number, name and finalisation status of the projects in the database. Returns false if there are no projects in the database and returns true if there are.
      Parameters:
      results - object to store statement query results
      statement - object used to query the database
      Returns:
      boolean value
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • updateFieldForProject

      public void updateFieldForProject(Statement statement, boolean needsParenthesis, String fieldToUpdate, String dataToInsert, String projectId) throws SQLException
      Method to update a field for a project in the database.
      Parameters:
      statement - object used to update the database
      needsParenthesis - whether to input need '' or not
      fieldToUpdate - the field being updated
      dataToInsert - the data being inserted
      projectId - the id/project number
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • updateTwoFieldsForProject

      public void updateTwoFieldsForProject(Statement statement, boolean firstNeedsParenthesis, String firstFieldToUpdate, String firstDataToInsert, boolean secondNeedsParenthesis, String secondFieldToUpdate, String secondDataToInsert, String projectId) throws SQLException
      Method to update two fields at once for a project in a database
      Parameters:
      statement - object used to update the database
      firstNeedsParenthesis - whether the first data input needs ''
      firstFieldToUpdate - the field of the first data point
      firstDataToInsert - first data to insert
      secondNeedsParenthesis - whether the second data input needs ''
      secondFieldToUpdate - the field of the second data point
      secondDataToInsert - second data to insert
      projectId - the id/project number
      Throws:
      SQLException - message for if an SQL error occurs

    • checkDate

      public static boolean checkDate(String userInput)
      Method which returns a boolean value to show whether a user input can be parsed as a date. Returns true if it can, returns false if it can't
      Parameters:
      userInput - user's input
      Returns:
      boolean value
